t: The Colombian Amazon-Orinoco | Tourism | Colombia Travel
s: An awe-inspiring blanket of green that spreads as far as the eye can see, the sacred forests and sweeping plains of the Colombian Amazon-Orinoco are a bastion of biodiversity and one of the world’s last great wildernesses.

The department is part of the Colombian Amazon-Orinoquia. The greenest region of the country, where rivers flow through the jungle and plains, also where communities and nature coexist in harmony. It is also divided into two territories that are home to natural scenery and ancestral cultures ...

March 14, 2025 - The Casiquiare river or canal (Spanish pronunciation: [kasiˈkjaɾe]) is a natural distributary of the upper Orinoco flowing southward into the Rio Negro, in Venezuela, South America. As such, it forms a unique natural canal between the Orinoco and Amazon river systems.

The Amazon and the Orinoco range from high in the snowcapped Andean mountains to lowland rainforests and grasslands. The Amazon Basin is the largest tropical wilderness area in the world and the most biodiverse region on earth. It's also the greatest freshwater system on the planet, accounting ...

1 week ago - From April to May 1800, the Prussian-born Alexander von Humboldt and his companion, Aime Bonpland, explored stretches of the Orinoco, supported by indigenous helpers and guided by his interest to prove that South America's waterways formed an interconnected system from the Andes to the Amazon.
